org.bytedeco.pytorch

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer
      • org.bytedeco.pytorch.Device
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    @Namespace(value="c10")
 @NoOffset
 @Properties(inherit=torch.class)
public class Device
extends Pointer
    Represents a compute device on which a tensor is located. A device is uniquely identified by a type, which specifies the type of machine it is (e.g. CPU or CUDA GPU), and a device index or ordinal, which identifies the specific compute device when there is more than one of a certain type. The device index is optional, and in its defaulted state represents (abstractly) "the current device". Further, there are two constraints on the value of the device index, if one is explicitly stored: 1. A negative index represents the current device, a non-negative index represents a specific, concrete device, 2. When the device type is CPU, the device index must be zero.

      • Device

        public Device(@StdString
              BytePointer device_string)
        Constructs a Device from a string description, for convenience. The string supplied must follow the following schema: (cpu|cuda)[:<device-index>] where cpu or cuda specifies the device type, and :<device-index> optionally specifies a device index.

              String device_string)
